Key Match Events: Wyatt Langford made a leaping, game-ending catch at the top of the wall in left field on a 104 mph liner from Giancarlo Stanton with two runners on after Trent Grisham’s two-out grand slam.
Trent Grisham’s two-out grand slam in the ninth inning
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Judge and Juan Soto had left the game in the eighth inning because of the 10-2 deficit, so Judge was already assured of his ninth consecutive game without going deep — he had a pair of eight-game stretches earlier this season.
Manager Aaron Boone said, 'Nobody’s going to feel sorry for us,' emphasizing the team's mindset and determination to improve.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge said, 'We’ve still got a long month ahead of us, big series coming up here in Chicago,' reflecting on the team's future prospects.
Marcus Stroman said, 'We’re all very process-oriented in this clubhouse so we know what we’re capable of,' showing the team's resilience and focus.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees were without a specific closer after two-time All-Star Clay Holmes gave up Langford’s drive with New York on the cusp of a series victory.
The Yankees are currently without a specific closer after two-time All-Star Clay Holmes gave up Langford’s drive with New York on the cusp of a series victory.
